channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024071679
item.description:
Report X-2024071679

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found In QA department, unsure who brought it to QA or when or how the leakage occurred. There are two commodities in this package Part A is a regulated hazmat but Part B is not. DGNAV would not allow me to add any info in the 16a or b section because it did not populate.

Report X-2024071406

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon inspection of the package it was found that the Hazmat was not properly placed in the truck, when the door was opened for AM sort the Hazmat fell out landing on the seal causing a small crack/ hole in the seam leaking out the ACETONE any time he package is picked up.

item.title: Report E-2024070484
item.description:
Report E-2024070484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifteen (15) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to falling freight that punctured the drum resulting in the released material impacting the trailer floor. Dayton Freight cleaned the impacted area and containerized the recovered clean-up material into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was overpacked. The generated waste was staged at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071441
item.description:
Report X-2024071441

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA department for a tape up due to the bottom being belt burned and tape coming undone by someone other than a QA admin. Package was sat upside down on a metal cart and was later found to have leaked and damaged the top of the top of the package.
